title: Rovi Announces New Customer Deployment and Interactive Guide Solution at SCTE (VOD Professional)
text:
Rovi Announces New Customer Deployment and Interactive Guide Solution at SCTE Also announced Panasonic adopts Rovi G-Guide xD for VIERA smart TVs and DIGA Blu-Ray recorders Newsdesk 14 Oct 2015 
Rovi Corporation today announced Rovi's first customer for Passport Guide HD, Summit Broadband, and introduced i-Guide HD, the company's newest addition to its line of interactive program guides. Summit Broadband, a provider of phone, internet, and cable TV services for residential and commercial customers, has selected Rovi's innovative Passport Guide HD to deliver advanced entertainment discovery, powered by Rovi's entertainment metadata. The addition of Passport Guide HD now provides Summit Broadband with expanded TV listings and a fresh design for DVR, search and advanced VOD capabilities. 
Rovi also unveiled its new i-Guide HD solution, which provides a high-resolution, wide-screen design for a full HD experience. The newly designed i-Guide HD supports applications to help service providers extend customer engagement, while offering the same easy-to-use navigation consumers are familiar with. It also features new HD Auto-Tune, which ensures viewers are watching their favourite shows in the highest possible resolution. 
Mark Lipford, COO at Summit Broadband , said: Rovi's history in delivering proven guide technologies are a natural fit for Summit Broadband as we continue to shape the entertainment viewing experience in the homes of our subscribers. Customers will enjoy using the advanced features offered by Rovi's Passport Guide HD such as its streamlined HD interface, intuitive design, and robust discovery capabilities. 
Sarah Gaeta, Vice President and General Manager of Guides Products at Rovi , said: As more entertainment options become available to consumers, service providers like Summit Broadband look to Rovi to help them differentiate offerings with high-quality solutions in order to remain competitive. Rovi continues to evolve our renowned interactive program guide to arm our customers with the advanced capabilities to deliver the best entertainment discovery experience to millions of households. 
Rovi also announced today that Panasonic has selected Rovi's multi-platform interactive program guide, G-Guide xD, for the new version of the Panasonic Media Access mobile app launching this month. With the Panasonic Media Access application powered by G-Guide xD, users of VIERA Smart TVs and DIGA Blu-Ray Recorders now have the ability to discover, record and view entertainment content on their mobile devices. For the first time in Japan, G-Guide xD now includes the ability to search programs that have previously aired, enabling subscribers to find and watch recorded TV programs on the app or on TV. 
Michael Hawkey, Senior Vice President and General Manager of Discovery at Rovi , said: Rovi's collaboration with Panasonic furthers our vision of enhancing the consumer entertainment experience across the globe. G-Guide xD offers service providers and CE manufacturers, like Panasonic, the ability to deliver unique entertainment discovery products and services for the vast amount of digital content options available today. 
G-Guide xD is a mobile-based guide for iOS and Android devices that works similarly to Rovi's G-Guide, an interactive program guide for Japan's digital terrestrial, broadcast satellite, and commercial satellite services. G-Guide xD also enables remote DVR control, providing features like picture-in-picture, and allows viewers to quickly find and easily record TV programming.
